introduction: The following passage is adapted from The Rise and Fall of the Dinosaurs by Steve Brusatte (2018).
text: In the late Jurassic period, dinosaurs flourished in ecosystems rich with vegetation and diverse prey. One of the most notable species of the time, the Diplodocus, was a massive herbivore that roamed what is now North America. Fossil evidence suggests that by the end of the Jurassic, populations of Diplodocus ______ significantly, likely due to changes in climate and food availability.
question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English? Focus on selecting a verb form that appropriately conveys the time frame of the described events and maintains logical coherence with the historical context.
explanation: Choice B is the best answer. The past perfect had declined is appropriate because it indicates that the decline occurred before the end of the Jurassic period, establishing a clear sequence of events. Choice A is incorrect because the present perfect has declined suggests a connection to the present, which is inconsistent with the historical context of the passage. Choice C is incorrect because the present tense decline disrupts the past narrative and incorrectly implies an ongoing process. Choice D is incorrect because the future tense will decline inaccurately suggests that the decline had not yet occurred by the end of the Jurassic period.
